article_title: U.S. Consumer Spending Rises 0.5% in August
article_text:
WASHINGTON—Consumer spending rose a seasonally adjusted 0.5% in August from a month earlier and personal income rose 0.3%, putting the U.S. economy on track for solid growth in the third quarter that ends on Tuesday, Commerce Department figures showed.

Recent growth in spending and income is "acceptable," J.P. Morgan Chase economist Michael Feroli said. "But it would be nice to see some acceleration."

...

article_metadata.author: Ben Leubsdorf
article_metadata.article.origheadline: U.S. Consumer Spending Increased 0.5% in August

article_summary:
Recent growth in spending and income is "acceptable," J.P. Morgan Chase economist Michael Feroli said.
WASHINGTON—Consumer spending rose a seasonally adjusted 0.5% in August from a month earlier and personal income rose 0.3%, putting the U.S. economy on track for solid growth in the third quarter that ends on Tuesday, Commerce Department figures showed.
"But it would be nice to see some acceleration."
